content.html: :+1: this is awesome. I could have totally used this if I knew visual plugins existed O_o

content.raw: I'm curious: why not sim time?
content.html: I'm curious: why not sim time?

content.raw: I wanted that... But that's not readily available to rendering. We would need to subscribe to `world_stats`, which adds some complexity to the example.
content.html: I wanted that... But that's not readily available to rendering. We would need to subscribe to world_stats, which adds some complexity to the example.

content.raw: I think it's worth the added complexity. We can make an issue for it if you don't want to add it to this already excellent pull request
content.html: I think it's worth the added complexity. We can make an issue for it if you don't want to add it to this already excellent pull request

content.raw:
Due to popular demand, the plugin now uses sim time by default: 8629dca. I added the parameter `use_wall_time` in case someone wants to use wall time. For higher frequencies, sim time gets really clunky, as you can see in the video:

https://youtu.be/SGTuyK8uAm8
content.html:
Due to popular demand, the plugin now uses sim time by default: 8629dca. I added the parameter use_wall_time in case someone wants to use wall time. For higher frequencies, sim time gets really clunky, as you can see in the video:

https://youtu.be/SGTuyK8uAm8

content.raw: This seems unique to Visual plugins. I don't think other plugins have their innerxml wrapped in an `sdf` tag. I wonder why that is the case?
content.html: This seems unique to Visual plugins. I don't think other plugins have their innerxml wrapped in an sdf tag. I wonder why that is the case?

See my answer for proof/info

content.raw: humm I think we should fix this, and make all plugin types consistent. But since this will break user code, it can't go in this PR, which is targeted at Gazebo7. I think we can merge this into 7, and do the fix on default, what do you think? Having an example before and after the fix might help users with migration.
content.html: humm I think we should fix this, and make all plugin types consistent. But since this will break user code, it can't go in this PR, which is targeted at Gazebo7. I think we can merge this into 7, and do the fix on default, what do you think? Having an example before and after the fix might help users with migration.

content.raw:
yeah, it's a tricky one

I'm trying to think of a way to tick-tock the change
content.html:
yeah, it's a tricky one

I'm trying to think of a way to tick-tock the change

content.raw: We could have all the innerxml duplicated, so the same information can be found inside `<plugin>` and `<plugin><sdf>`?
content.html: We could have all the innerxml duplicated, so the same information can be found inside <plugin> and <plugin><sdf>?

content.raw: good idea. I wonder if they could get a console warning when they try to access the `<sdf>` element. I don't know if that's possible
content.html: good idea. I wonder if they could get a console warning when they try to access the <sdf> element. I don't know if that's possible

content.raw: That would be nice, not sure if it's possible. I think the only problem with duplicating the innerxml is if they have a custom tag called `<sdf>`.
content.html: That would be nice, not sure if it's possible. I think the only problem with duplicating the innerxml is if they have a custom tag called <sdf>.

content.raw: yeah, let's duplicate the `innerxml` as you suggested and then remove the `<sdf>` tags from gazebo8 and write it up in the Migration document, on the gazebo answer and perhaps in a visual plugin tutorial if we ever make one
content.html: yeah, let's duplicate the innerxml as you suggested and then remove the <sdf> tags from gazebo8 and write it up in the Migration document, on the gazebo answer and perhaps in a visual plugin tutorial if we ever make one

content.raw: Oh you mean "deprecate" the `<sdf>` tag on Gazebo7, which has already been released?
content.html: Oh you mean "deprecate" the <sdf> tag on Gazebo7, which has already been released?

content.raw: I think we can't programmatically deprecate it; we can just document that it's deprecated. But if we duplicate the tags in gazebo7, then I think we can remove them in gazebo8
content.html: I think we can't programmatically deprecate it; we can just document that it's deprecated. But if we duplicate the tags in gazebo7, then I think we can remove them in gazebo8

content.raw: but I don't think it's too controversial to suggest we duplicate the tags in gazebo7. the controversial part would be removing them in gazebo8
content.html: but I don't think it's too controversial to suggest we duplicate the tags in gazebo7. the controversial part would be removing them in gazebo8

content.raw: Take a look at commits fe9f03a and 4fe9ac0.
content.html: Take a look at commits fe9f03a and 4fe9ac0.

content.raw: This is a start, but `~/world_stats` is only published at 5 Hz in sim time, so it's going to look kinda choppy
content.html: This is a start, but ~/world_stats is only published at 5 Hz in sim time, so it's going to look kinda choppy

content.raw: the `~/pose/local/info` topic has a timestamp and is published at a higher rate
content.html: the ~/pose/local/info topic has a timestamp and is published at a higher rate

content.raw: Interesting, I thought the pose topics would only publish when there are pose changes, which is the case for `~/pose/info`. But now I saw on a [comment](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/17137a79cbe8a936a63dccdca8a637fc92067692/gazebo/physics/World.cc?fileviewer=file-view-default#World.cc-203) that `~/pose/local/info` specifically, is used to timestamp sensors. I've been meaning to write a tutorial explaining all of Gazebo's default topics, this is the kind of information which I think could be useful.
content.html: Interesting, I thought the pose topics would only publish when there are pose changes, which is the case for ~/pose/info. But now I saw on a comment that ~/pose/local/info specifically, is used to timestamp sensors. I've been meaning to write a tutorial explaining all of Gazebo's default topics, this is the kind of information which I think could be useful.

content.raw: I think it's only meant for high-bandwidth local network access. It will kill the system if a remote gzclient tries to subscribe
content.html: I think it's only meant for high-bandwidth local network access. It will kill the system if a remote gzclient tries to subscribe

content.raw: So is this something we would want to use in a `VisualPlugin`? Would we be encouraging bad practices?
content.html: So is this something we would want to use in a VisualPlugin? Would we be encouraging bad practices?

content.raw: I think we should do it but document the risks.
content.html: I think we should do it but document the risks.

content.raw: What do you think? e1a9064
content.html: What do you think? e1a9064

content.raw: that looks much smoother!
content.html: that looks much smoother!

content.raw: A little late to the discussion but there is a [Scene::SimTime()](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/b0fb88220780fe2d4b4b00cfb776d35714a611b2/gazebo/rendering/Scene.hh?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default#Scene.hh-650) function that could be used here.
content.html: A little late to the discussion but there is a Scene::SimTime() function that could be used here.

content.raw: I think that on the client side, the sim time in Scene is coming from `~/pose/info`, which is only published when there are pose changes. Right? While `~/pose/local/info` is published all the time.
content.html: I think that on the client side, the sim time in Scene is coming from ~/pose/info, which is only published when there are pose changes. Right? While ~/pose/local/info is published all the time.

content.raw: ah yes, that's right
content.html: ah yes, that's right

content.raw: This check keeps it from handling `Reset world` events well. Do `VisualPlugin`s get `Reset`ed?
content.html: This check keeps it from handling Reset world events well. Do VisualPlugins get Reseted?

content.raw: They do. I'll implement reset. Chotto matte.
content.html: They do. I'll implement reset. Chotto matte.

content.raw:
Resetting time shouldn't break the plugin anymore: 47ee845

But I noticed that even though visual plugins have a `Reset` function, that is never called. I ticketed issue #2012. It's a bit tricky because since VisualPlugins are on the client side, we can't connect to `event::Events::timeReset` for example. I think visuals would need to subscribe to `~/world_control`.
content.html:
Resetting time shouldn't break the plugin anymore: 47ee845

But I noticed that even though visual plugins have a Reset function, that is never called. I ticketed issue #2012. It's a bit tricky because since VisualPlugins are on the client side, we can't connect to event::Events::timeReset for example. I think visuals would need to subscribe to ~/world_control.

content.raw: @iche033 , if you have some time, could you take a look at why the visuals are not disappearing when transparency goes to 1 and alpha to 0? Any guidance is welcome, thanks!
content.html: @iche033 , if you have some time, could you take a look at why the visuals are not disappearing when transparency goes to 1 and alpha to 0? Any guidance is welcome, thanks!

can you give this a try:

diff -r af85f4e55b33 gazebo/rendering/Visual.cc
--- a/gazebo/rendering/Visual.cc    Mon Aug 01 09:45:46 2016 -0700
+++ b/gazebo/rendering/Visual.cc    Tue Aug 02 12:01:23 2016 -0700
@@ -1227,6 +1227,7 @@
   }

   this->dataPtr->diffuse = _color;
+  this->UpdateTransparency();

   this->dataPtr->sdf->GetElement("material")
       ->GetElement("diffuse")->Set(_color);
